climbs.name: You Can't Take the Sky From Me

content.description:
In a battle between claustrophobia and acres of air below you, this climb forces you to fight for any shred of sky you can.

 20ft of upside-down, offwidth hell leads to an mild finger traverse, and then 40ft of your standard chimney (lil' dirty, lil' runnout, lil' fun).
content.protection: Single rack of mid-big cams.  A #5 protects the crux (or lets you aid out of the roof section). The chimney is well protected via pockets deep in the back.
content.location: It's the bigtime crack intertwined with Space Cowboy.

content.description:
A pockety line starting from up on the ledge. This area is rarely trafficked but the holds stay nice and clean. Good route for the young leader. Also, a nice ledge up top to teach cleaning anchors. It's just near a 5.9 and past several other 5.9s. A very good beginner area.  

  The hardest moves are near the bottom, then move up and left for jugs.
content.location: Get up on the ledge, it's the obvious bolted pocket line on the left.

content.description: It’s the route down the corridor from Lindapalooza on the left side of the cliffline
Good pockets and jugs to clip from.  A few bulges with good feet.  Slab after last hanger to anchors.  Move right for good feet and a hand jam.
content.location: It starts about 6 feet right of "Katie Did". From "Vertical Heartland" 3rd edition by Eric Ulner.

content.description: About 30 feet past the S.S. Minnow, it starts just right of the big, overhung dihedral. Cross the crack after the second clip and face climb through the bulge to the top. 8 QD + anchor. From "Vertical Heartland" 3rd edition by Eric Ulner

climbs.name: Possum Grits
climbs.fa: Ed English, Jim Schneider, Granny Clampett, 1998

content.description: Start on the bulgy start. Good rest just by the first bolt, nice safe start. The trick is finding the underclings throughout. Really good 5.9 on bomber sandstone. Good jugs at the top. Various beta to get from the last bolt to the anchor. Pick your adventure!
content.location: Just left and including the arete before the small ledge that leads to Whee Doggies

climbs.name: Monkey Shower
climbs.fa: Jim Schneider, Margie Belt, Mike Braun, 1998

content.description: Bulge between 2nd and 3rd clips is the crux.  Pinches, heuco's and jugs.  A little overhanging for 1/2 of route, transitions to slab.
content.location: It's 50 feet right of "I Be Lichen It", and on the outer west side of the Town Square. From "Vertical Heartland" 3rd edition by Eric Ulner

content.description: Good holds lead to a big move off of undercling jugs. Connect the huecos with what few feet options you have, and move through one more section to gain the ledge/rest. Easier climbing leads you to the anchors.Note: Height dependent moves will make this much harder for anyone under 5’7.
content.location: Leftmost line on the Space Cowboy wall. Scramble up the platform to begin.

content.description: Lieback the juggy lip on the left side of this crack, don't forget to look for good feet on the left for rests. Sustained and continuous, a fun natural feature to climb.
content.protection: Toprope off the Whee Dogies! anchor (don't fall, or wide piece as a directional), or lead with extremely wide gear.
content.location: The obvious crack feature to the left of "Whee Doggies!" 5.8, and just to the right of "Possum Grits" 5.9.

content.description: The route at the entrance to the corridor.
content.location: The route across the hallway, on the cliff line, to the left of I Be Lichen It

content.description: Good feet, a few bulges to get over.  Pinches, heucos and jugs.  Bolts nicely spaced.
content.location: It's about 12 feet right of "Monkey Shower". From "Vertical Heartland" 3rd edition by Eric Ulner.

content.description: Sustained overhanging route.  Tough finish to the anchors.
content.location: As you first approach the Town Square from The Basement, this route will be in front of you. It's the overhanging route on the north side. From "Vertical Heartland" 3rd edition by Eric Ulner

climbs.name: Gully Gee Whiz
climbs.fa: Schott Mueller (1998). FFA: Jeff Frizzell, David Kessler (2004)

content.description: There is a water dike in the middle of this route.  Pull slopers, pinches, side pulls, pockets, and under-clings.  Boulder to gain the lower bulge, then enter the gully, use your shoulders.  At the top of the gully, come out on the face and pick the pockets on the first roof up to the giant fin.
content.location: On the SW corner, the last route before rounding the corner and continuing on the main trail.  Just Southeast of Town Square.

content.description: Variation on "Space Cowboy", continue left to the separate anchor. 8 QD + anchor. From "Vertical Heartland" 3rd edition by Eric Ulner
Fun and juggy laybacking and stemming with good gear. Crux is probably 1/3 the way up.
content.protection: Large gear from 1" to 4", two size 3 C4s would be helpful, and a #4 C4 is nice for the first piece. I used the small tree at the top and a #2 C4 in the crack below it to make a top rope anchor. Bring some longs slings or cordelette to make this easier.
content.location: Left leaning feature to the left of Bubbling Crude. Used the anchors on "Possum Grits", two routes to the right, to descend after cleaning the top rope anchor.

content.description: Boulder up to the 2nd bolt.  Wrestle your way around the fin and fight to the anchors. Unique movement for the Falls!  Grade is a guess, please add your opinion. First TR ascent: Jeff Frizzell
content.location: Starts in the overhang right of Spank You Very Much.  Rap off Metolius Rap anchors

content.description: Climb up an easy section to get to the business. Climb up and over a couple of bulges with good clipping stances, and push through the crux above the final bolt.  Fun, and very well protected!
content.location: This is the first route on Belleville Wall.  Walk 80 feet past The Basement and look to your left.  This is the overhanging route going up the wall just past the corner.

content.description: Engaging climbing throughout, chains are slightly to the right of the rest of the climb. Crux is probably clipping the chains, I traversed over and clipped while still below the bulge, but it also looks like you could pull over and then traverse to the anchors, although that also seems a little strange.
content.location: Bolted line to the left of "Possum Grits" 5.9, and just to the right of the 5.8 crack feature "Double Knot Spy."

content.description: The wall that wraps around the Town Square (Between the basement and the SS Minnow).  This area is north-facing and shady.
